context: In the centre of <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a5_0><a5_1><a5_2><b12_0>Basel<b12_0/><a5_2/><a5_1/><a5_0/><a0_1/><a0_0/>,<a0_2/> the first major city in the course of the stream, is located the "<a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a6_0><a6_1><a6_2><b10_0><b11_0>Rhine knee<b11_0/><b10_0/><a6_2/><a6_1/><a6_0/><a1_2/><a1_1/><a1_0/>"; this is a major bend, where the overall direction of the Rhine changes from West to <a7_0><a7_1><a7_2>North<a7_2/><a7_1/><a7_0/>. Here the <a8_0><a8_1><a8_2>High Rhine<a8_2/><a8_1/><a8_0/> ends. Legally, the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a9_0><a9_1><a9_2>Central Bridge<a9_2/><a9_1/><a9_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> is the boundary between High and Upper Rhine. The river now flows North as Upper Rhine through the Upper Rhine Plain, which is about <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><b13_0>300 km<b13_0/> long<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> and up to <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b14_0>40 km<b14_0/><a4_2/> wide<a4_1/><a4_0/>. The most important tributaries in this area are the Ill below of Strasbourg, the Neckar in Mannheim and the Main across from Mainz. In Mainz, the Rhine leaves the Upper Rhine Valley and flows through the Mainz Basin.
